results.name: The survivor w(n,4) in a modified Josephus problem, with a step of 4.
link: Chris Groër, The Mathematics of Survival: From Antiquity to the Playground, Amer. Math. Monthly, 110(9) (2003), 812-825.
Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
mathematica: w4[1] = v4[1] = u4[1] = 1; w4[n_] := w4[n] = Switch[ Mod[n, 4], 0, n + 1 - Ceiling[4w4[ Ceiling[3n/4]]/3], 1, n + 1 - Floor[(4w4[ Ceiling[3n/4]] + 1)/3], 2, n + 1 - Floor[4v4[ Ceiling[3n/4]]/3], 3, n + 1 - Floor[(4u4[ Ceiling[3n/4]] - 1)/3]]; v4[n_] := v4[n] = Switch[ Mod[n, 4], 0, n + 1 - Floor[(4w4[ Ceiling[3n/4]] + 1)/3], 1, n + 1 - Floor[(4v4[ Ceiling[3n/4]])/3], 2, n + 1 - Floor[(4u4[ Ceiling[3n/4]] - 1)/3], 3, n + 1 - Ceiling[ 4w4[ Floor[3n/4]]/3]]; u4[n_] := u4[n] = Switch[ Mod[n, 4], 0, n + 1 - Floor[ 4v4[ Ceiling[3n/4]]/3], 1, n + 1 - Floor[ (4u4[ Ceiling[3n/4]] - 1)/3], 2, n + 1 - Ceiling[ 4w4[ Floor[3n/4]]/3], 3, n + 1 - Floor[(4w4[ Floor[3n/4]] + 1)/3]]; Table[ w4[n], {n, 81}] (* from Chris Groer modified by _Robert G. Wilson v_ Nov 15 2003 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 09 2003
